cip.render.raytrace.geometry

Class Paraboloid

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AGeometry
      • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AQuadricGeo
        • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.Paraboloid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry

    public class Paraboloid
extends AQuadricGeo
    This is the implementation of an elliptical paraboloid with tip at 0,0,0 in the object coordinate system. The paraboloid opens upward (toward +k), and is specified by 3 scalars: 'height' is the height of the object from tip to "cup rim", 'Xradius' is the width of the cup opening along the i axis, and 'Yradius' is the width of the cup opening along the j axis. NOTE: the paraboloid is of infinite extent unless clipping is specified.

    The paraboloid is specified as a node in an XML file as: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.Paraboloid" name="coneName">
         <radius>radius</radius>
         <radius>Xradius,Yradius</radius>
         <height>height</height>
         <MaterialByRef name="materialName"/>
         <DynamicallyLoadedObjectclass="materialClass">
               .
             material specific nodes and attributes
               .
         </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    radius The radii of the paraboloid. This is specified either as a single value which is applied to i and j resulting in a paraboloid (the special case of the elliptical paraboloid); or as 2 values that will be applied as X radius and Y radius. The default is a paraboloid of radii 1,2 if not specified.
    height The positive Z distance from 0,0,0 where the paraboloid has the specified radii.
    MaterialByRef A material specified by reference to the name of a previously loaded material. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.
    DynamicallyLoadedObject The specification for a material for the paraboloid. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies a paraboloid with base radii 1, 2 and height 5: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.Paraboloid" name="paraboloid 1">
         <radius>1.0f, 2.0f</radius>
         <height>5.0f</height>
         <MaterialByRef name="blue"/>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0

      • getConvexHullVertices

        public Point3f[] getConvexHullVertices()
        Returns an array of 24 points that are the vertices of a convex hull described by a min-max box with the corners trimmed by planes that are perpendicular to the diagonals of the 8 quadrants of a 3D axis system.
        Specified by:
        getConvexHullVertices in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        getConvexHullVertices in class AGeometry
        Returns:
        Returns the array of convex hull vertices, Returns null if a convex hull cannot be fit to the object. Being unable to fit a convex hull implies that the object must be explicitly queried for intersection on every ray.

      • getNaturalCoordinates

        public void getNaturalCoordinates(RayIntersection intersection)
        The natural mapping for a paraboloid is U equal to degrees longitude measured counter-clockwise (looking down) starting at the +i axis being 0 degree (+j = 90 degree, -i = 180 degree, and -j = 270 degree). And V being latitude in degrees * starting at -90 degrees for -k, and +90 degree for +k. The Paraboloid does not compute natural coordinates unless they are specifically requested using this function.
        Specified by:
        getNaturalCoordinates in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        getNaturalCoordinates in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The ray intersection.
